title: Application error message
overview:
<paragraph>Information Leakage is an application weakness where an application reveals sensitive data, such as technical details of the web application, environment, or user-specific data. Sensitive data may be used by an attacker to exploit the target web application, its hosting network, or its users. <paragraph></paragraph> In its most common form, information leakage is the result of one or more of the following conditions:
 * A failure to scrub out HTML/Script comments containing sensitive information
 * Improper application or server configurations
 * Improper application error handling
</paragraph>
remediation:
<paragraph> * Ensure that the application source handles exceptions and errors in a such a way that no sensitive information is disclosed to the users
 * Configure the application server to handle and log any exceptions that the application might yield
</paragraph>
